title: What is the acceleration of gravity on the Moon with proof? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not sure what you would cal proof. This if from Wikipedia with references. The acceleration due to gravity on the surface of the Moon is about 1.625 m/s2, about 16.6% that on Earth's surface or 0.166 ɡ. Over the entire surface, the variation in gravitational acceleration is about 0.0253 m/s2 (1.6% of the acceleration due to gravity). Because weight is directly dependent upon gravitational acceleration, things on the Moon will weigh only 16.6% (≈ 1/6) of what they weigh on the Earth. Gravitation of the Moon - Wikipedia
Just use g = G M/R^2, where G is the universal gravitational constant, M is the mass of the moon and R is the radius of the moon. Google for these values and calculate g.
